Connect-4 is a two-player game played on a 4x4 grid. Players take turns placing their chips in any empty cell. 

The first player to align four of their chips in a row, column, or diagonal wins the game. If all cells are filled and no player has four in a row, the game ends in a draw. 

Think ahead and try to block your opponent!

Normal mode is played on a 4x4 grid. Players take turns placing their tokens in any empty cell. 

The first player to align four of their tokens in a row, column, or diagonal wins the game. If all cells are filled and no player has four in a row, the game ends in a draw. 

Think ahead and try to block your opponent!

Gravity mode is played on a 5x6 grid. Players take turns placing their tokens in any unfilled column. 

The first player to align four of their tokens in a row, column, or diagonal wins the game. If all cells are filled and no player has four in a row, the game ends in a draw. 

Think ahead and try to block your opponent!
